website_summaries.verdict: The best budget diving computer with an impressive, large screen for easy reading at a glance.
pros: The large numerical screen displays all of the most important diving information you need all at once
Computer sports vital tracking features such as depth, diving time, ascentation rate, and decompression time
cons: Included instructions can be difficult to read
Computer may require some practice runs to get you acclimated

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the regular recreational diver - Very conservative in it's profiling.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made product, excellent size for viewing key information. Options on colors (nice for the wife) It's a value based product - robust and gives the data I need - I'm a minimalist and have little desire to do cave / technical / rebreather - wouldnt use the Shearwater...But...this is very conservative in it's dive profile. Still deciding if it needs to be returned. Maybe I went too 'value priced' ?
customer_reviews.author: DTee

customer_reviews.title: Great budget computer that does all the basics
customer_reviews.text: So far this dive watch has proved to be exactly what I was looking for. Features I'd hoped for: -Basic dive planning -Depth tracking (max and current) -Dive time tracking -Temperature I purchase this based on the reviews and price point, at some point it will be my "back-up" computer, but I love it so far. The strap is a little long, but better to be too long than too short
customer_reviews.author: Christopher H.

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Cressi Leonardo in August 2016....I've already used it last weekend lake diving in michigan. Worked awesome! Going soon for shipwreck diving and can't wait to use it. It's everything I wanted. I'm still very new to scuba diving and this is a great entry level dive computer. Yes.....the watch face is obnoxiously large and the wrist band is very long. I prefer the large face on it, makes easy to see under water. I also like the fact that you can change the battery in it.
customer_reviews.author: TropicalJ

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for freediving
customer_reviews.text: Work well as a dive computer however I bought this device in a hope to use it for scuba diving as well as for the free diving in the Gage mode. The User Manual and specs indicated that in the Gage mode it can be use for Apnea as a depth gage and time with Minutes:Seconds of the dive. In reality the computer only count time in Minutes which is useless for free diving. Manual is actually very deceiving hence only 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how to use all the functions, but I did go from box to dive with no issues. I found someone on my dive boat with the same watch and asked for a lesson. I had to laugh because he did the same thing. He just jumped in and used the basic features. Neither of us had a problem.... Most people had newer and lighter equipment on the boat, but this one was priced well below theirs and it achieved the same goal. I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 because it is so bulky and the strap is way to big.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a back up dive computer. I like the one button function. It's super easy to use and set up. Easy to read under water. It is a little bulky for my small, female wrist, but overall a great computer. I had to cut a little off the wrist band. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Donny

customer_reviews.title: Easy to go from air to nitrox
customer_reviews.text: Took about ten minutes to figure how to set. Easy to go from air to nitrox. Had to buy a hard box to keep it in. Directions are online and you probably should mess around with it before you go out. It comes preset at conservative 1.4 which was beeping the whole time for ascending to rapidly while lobster diving. There is only one button so it's nice except with you push the button too many time and have to cycle through 59 more 12:04. Good buy for the money I have done 12 tanks with it. Also, it has a gage only setting.
customer_reviews.author: panda2090

customer_reviews.title: Great recreational dive computer
customer_reviews.text: Like this dive computer a lot. Easy to read and understand the data it's providing, even at depth. Cressi software and usb interface works without a lot of hassle. My wife and I got these as backup computers for a week of diving in Cozumel. I liked it so much, that I used it as my primary computer.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great starter computer.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great introduction computer if you’re just getting started and don’t want to drop $1,000+ on a dive computer. My only complaint about is the backlight is on a incredibly short timer (kinda wish it stayed on until you held the button again to turn it off. One thing to keep note is that it is very conservative when it comes to no deco and whatnot. But it’s better to be conservative with that rather than liberal.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: No logging features
customer_reviews.text: This works fine on the dive to track time, depth, and nitrogen; however, I was very disappointed to find out that it doesn't log time and depth for more than the most recent dive without the expensive PC link. Lack of logging relegates it to the role of backup computer, unless you are in the habit of updating your dive log after each dive.
customer_reviews.author: E. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great intro dive computer
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. Dived all week making repetitive dives on the same day. Tracked nitrogen consumption and adjusted dive times and "No-deco limits". Ascent alarm with audio feedback to prevent fast ascents. Very intuitive and with only one button it is easy to operate. Large face easy to read. Very long wristband will go over wet or dry suit. If in gauge mode the computer only shows depth and dive time and will not compute deco limits for 48 hours after use in gauge mode.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Confirm return fees
customer_reviews.text: I wound up going with another watch, as recommended by our dive master, and glad for the change. I returned this one without having used it. NOTE: the strap is weirdly long...very very long....and pay attention to whatever the seller's return policy is. I wish I had noticed that first before ordering the device.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wiren

customer_reviews.title: This computer is perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have not actually dove with it yet but its big. Great for my old eyes because I do need glasses but shoud be fine with this computer. The band is big too but fits my small wrist. I can't wait to dive with this thing and when I do may update. I bought because I dove in Mexico and even though I was promised PSI was given Bar. Never again. Nice to have your own computer and it gives you automatic 3 minute wait.
customer_reviews.author: Van Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for this price range
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my husband for Christmas, and although he hasn't used it in the water yet, he likes it very much. I am also a diver, and I researched these dive watch/computers carefully. This appeared to be the best one in this price range. Yes, there are more advanced options, but I didn't want to pay a thousand dollars. Everyone talks about how big the face is, so I was expecting something enormous. I think they were comparing it to a regular watch face, because I didn't find this any bigger than others I've seen. My husband was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Watch won't turn on.
customer_reviews.text: I just received my watch. I was extremely excited as this is my first. Its Friday and we just rented tanks for a Sunday dive. The watch came in a box that had clearly been opened before. I'm guessing this was someones returned item. The watch doesn't even turn on. Now I have to return this and rent a computer for this weekends dive. Very disappointed in the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Excellent computer and extremely easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: It was all as expected. I love the color and it is working really nice under water. Excellent computer and extremely easy to use. This computer is pretty easy to use, with its single button interface. It is pretty easy to read underwater I feel much very comfortable diving with this computer. It is good to know by beeping and signals that we are doing something wrong like going in a fast speed, easy to see the remaining time, the safety stop and the remaining time, etc. The computer is very conservative in its profiling. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Facundo M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and then some. Great dive computer easy to read and has great features for the price. Only down fall was it has water bubbles on screen after both first dives. They went away but kind of unnerving when I lost my last expensive computer to leakage
customer_reviews.author: Dave Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Don't seem 100% new
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't look 100% new plus I ordered grey/black and came only black
customer_reviews.author: Hernan Parra

customer_reviews.title: Strap is Too Large for Smaller Wrists
customer_reviews.text: This watch came highly recommended by fellow diving friends. That said, I'm 5"3 and weigh about 120lbs, and found this watch's strap could not go small enough to fit snugly on my wrist either with no wetsuit or with a 2mm wetsuit. I think if I had been wearing heavier layers, it may have fit. I dive in fairly warm waters, and so, unfortunately, I had to return this one.
customer_reviews.author: ben carroll

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Water gets behind the protective lens and fogs. I can't read the information. Cressi won't respond.
customer_reviews.author: R1mechanic

customer_reviews.title: Huge
customer_reviews.text: Can't comment on the functionality other than good viewing area and backlight. Unfortunately this thing is huge! The face is enormous and super bulky (even on my 6' 195 lb husband) and the wristband is so long... thing was sliding off my wrist even on the smallest setting and there's no way to make it smaller. Price is right and looks like its a good entry-level computer. Too bad it had to go back because of size.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Good starter computer
customer_reviews.text: First dive computer I've used. Things I like: Good price Easy to use Works right out of the box Things I dislike: Uncomfortable if not wearing a wetsuit Can't turn off alarm that goes off for accending too quickly. Every time I reached up to clear my mask it would go off. Very sensitive. Over all I like it as a beginner diver. But as I progress, and if I ever live somewhere where I get to dive a lot, I may look into something a little sleeker and programmable.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Solid intro purchase with longevity
customer_reviews.text: Great basic dive computer that handles all the functions you could want as a recreational diver, including Nitrox. Excellent purchase for a beginner, and if you want to upgrade later for a more advanced/expensive computer this will make a good backup for your main. Currently on Amazon for $200, which is a great deal. The only thing I don't like about it is the sensitivity of the ascent alarm, it will beep at you with relatively minor rapid ascents (like going from a horizontal to a vertical position on the bottom of a pool). Other than that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Black

customer_reviews.title: Cressi Sub WOW
customer_reviews.text: I had been watching this computer for more than two years, it never,never was really on sale HMMMMMM. no matter where I went same price.HMMMM again must be a good piece of hardware. So I gave Me an early Christmas present to Me.i looked in the mirror. to my surprise there was a happy face looking back at me HMMMM. good toy.
customer_reviews.author: noahtenbears

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have for any freediver and scubadiver.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have dive computer if you are free diver or scuba diver. Im a freedive spearfisher. And the deepest I fish is 120-135ft but this watch is able to go to 160-200 meters. Which at this point in time I'm not even going to test 100 meters lmao.. I HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS DIVE COMPUTER. I promise you will thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Schmitz Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Backlight not working
customer_reviews.text: This dive computer may be easy to use, but the backlight not working, which makes it useless during a deeper dive with low light conditions. This is when the computer is most needed. USELESS to me!!! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Janet B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - a bargain.
customer_reviews.text: Great computer, just put in on and it does all the work. I esp like the ascent warning. My wife is a newer diver and she 'corks' easily. The alerts her when she's ascending too quickly. It's improving her buoyancy control quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: CCC

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner computer
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Cresi Leonardo as a beginner dive computer 2 weeks before going on a dive trip to Cozumel. It is a basic computer with all the features a novice diver needs. The back light is a little weak, but I only dove during the day, so it was easy to read w/o the back light. Once you do the basic set up, it does the rest by itself. Turns on once you are in the water, and reads out depth, bottom time, and indicated accent rate. Logs max depth of each dive, and counts down time to fly. Great product for the beginner, at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.author: P. Winnie

customer_reviews.title: First time diver and this was easy to use
customer_reviews.text: First time diver and this was easy to use. No fly indicator helpful. The automatic start when hitting the water helped me initially on the first couple of dives. It allowed me to log dive activity when I still didn’t understand diving.
customer_reviews.author: Alley

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner divers
customer_reviews.text: This is my first dive watch and I love it. I’m a beginner and this is perfect for all my diving needs. I don’t need anything fancy just the basics and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Letty

customer_reviews.title: paid for brand new but received slightly used or returned.
customer_reviews.text: I've paid for brand new and expected brand new. However, it arrived in open box that was not sealed and scratched. I'm pretty sure it wasn't new, but either previously returned or slightly used as watch had mild scratches on the back. if it wasn't a gift, I'd return it immediately. Got very upset. i hope it works as expected since it's not brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Fairy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dive computer
customer_reviews.text: Used this as soon as a got it. Display is easy to read and all the functions are literally at your fingertips. I have used several different models over the years and Cressi has always stood out for ease of use and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Spicy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My suunto died and I found this as a replacement. Very easy to use, big screen for my failing eyesight, long lasting battery and I love the colour in white, as it is very recognizable and I am the only one with this colour. The strap was too long for my small wrist, so I just cut it abit shorter.
customer_reviews.author: Jin

customer_reviews.title: Simple one button design.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Simple one button design, hold button to select. Wish it recorded max temp for each dive but it truly is as simple as reported. It's my back up and very in sync (time, depths) with my ScubaPro wisdom 3 console.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Very easy to use. Great product. Incredible price. I’ve seen this in stores for $300
customer_reviews.author: rodrigo sologaistoa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use once I took the online class on how to use it. I'm a new diver and this was one of the first pieces of equipment I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t seem new
customer_reviews.text: The computer doesn’t seem new, it arrived and the battery is super low. It didn’t have any screen protector of any kind. It still functions well but it appears to be the one they had displayed at their store.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner Computer
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about it other than the size. There are much smaller dive computers that fit more like a watch and feel like a part of your body. This makes it difficult sometimes to put your BCD on without catching.
customer_reviews.author: Adam from Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great little computer and has many features. I compared it to many similar models and I'm happy with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: John Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great wrist computer
customer_reviews.text: I loved having this computer, easy to read and keeps track of my dives, would like more easy to use manual, but overall I am pleased with this dive computer. Being a woman and with small wrists, I wish it had an option for a smaller wrist band, although I can tighten it, it leaves a lot of band extending up and out.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Kinda disappointed from poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: Received damaged/used strap and damaged box This is my first dive computer I was so excited now I feel down :(
customer_reviews.author: Kareem N.

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: The dive watch works well, for the price. It saves your dive times and depths. It never lit up or glowed, like I thought it was suppose to. That sucked on my night dive. And if I moved my arm to quickly, it would beep, thinking I was changing depth to Quickly. But overall it was good.
customer_reviews.author: N. Benefield

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Does what a dive watch is supposed to do. Turns on automatically when you get in the water. You will need the adapter to connect to you computer for dive charts. Very detailed when uploaded.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Big screen, med-easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my buddy and he seemed to have hard time navigating around compare to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: MattyCAN

customer_reviews.title: Backlighting malfunction!
customer_reviews.text: Backlighting is so dim I cant read it in daylight let alone under water! Very disappointed with this and took over a week to ship!
customer_reviews.author: adriane

customer_reviews.title: Great beginning diver computer or backup
customer_reviews.text: Great simple product. Makes it easy for beginning divers or backup for advanced divers
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great dive computer
customer_reviews.text: Great dive computer. Easy to use and easy to read while diving. I like the pink and white but if I were to buy it again I'd get pink and black. I think overtime the white will yellow and show dirt/use more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent dive watch. Worked perfectly on our recent dive trip in Palawan.
customer_reviews.author: L.W.S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great easy to read large display and easily heard warning ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great easy to read large display and easily heard warning beeps when performing a 100 foot breath hold ascent. Computer did an absolutely terrible job of preventing arterial gas embolism. So maybe 4 and a half stars.
customer_reviews.author: luke flanders

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Good functionality for the money. Does as much as many more expensive dive computers. The only drawback was getting used to the 1-button interface.
customer_reviews.author: Sk8MagicMom

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it a few times since I bought it a month ago. It was easy to read both in clear and black water have been using it in training dives and am happy with it. Can’t wait to get to use recreationally
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: So mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly cheap design, one button interface, poor resolution- spend the extra $100-150 and get a better dive computer
customer_reviews.author: AmazonIsAFraud

customer_reviews.title: Easy and simple
customer_reviews.text: Used in the last 4 dives. Easy to use, easy to read, easy to navigate settings. Everything I needed in a cheap dive watch for a basic diver.
customer_reviews.author: Shaine Richards

customer_reviews.title: The best computer
customer_reviews.text: If you are new to scuba diving, this is the best investment you can make. It is simple and easy to use. Do not bother buying a complicate computer. Down there you want it simple.
customer_reviews.author: ORIOL

customer_reviews.title: Great Dive Watch!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic dive watch! Affordable, and does everything you need. We tested it on 4 dives- worked flawlessly, the screen is clear, and the controls are easy to use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GeoLady

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a beginner diver. This is easy to use and set up. I didn’t want to spend too much money starting out. This is a great watch and gives me a piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for new diver.
customer_reviews.text: New diver! Perfect for me. Only complaint. Strap is way too long and I can't find replacements online. Computer is big, but not too big. I have a small wrist and was worried.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: would buy again
customer_reviews.text: 20 Dives in and No problems only down to 70 feet so far but easy to use and seems to be a quality product
customer_reviews.author: Maverickva73

customer_reviews.title: So easy!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought these as backup computers, right before our computers were stolen. So last week in Bonaire these were our primary (only) dive computers. We loved how simple they are to use and understand. Easy to read underwater. I doubt very much we will bother to replace our expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: I buy everything online

customer_reviews.title: Works right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Best part, worked right out of the box. The one button function was easy and simple. For the record, holding that button turns the backlight on when on a night dive. That took me way too long to figure out, but it clearly says it in the manual. Overall, fantastic basic dive computer.
customer_reviews.author: DeliriousFX

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my latest dive trip. I thought there would be a steep learning curve to it but none at all. I asked one of the dive masters how to work it and he said it'll do it all on it's own, and it did.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: but I really like this unit
customer_reviews.text: Shipped on time. Just as described. I was a little skeptical of a low end dive computer, but I really like this unit. I have a dozen dives on it and it does everything I wanted. Good value. I will be buying another for my dive partner.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Plummer

customer_reviews.title: this is a wonderful product. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: For beginner and intermediate, this is a wonderful product. Easy to use, understand, and for those who rent their dive computer, it's worth the money. Great product, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Anna S.

customer_reviews.title: the computer did a great job and performed well
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from Roatan diving for 2 weeks... the computer did a great job and performed well. It was easy to use. I wish the online videos for training were free vs. charging you to learn to use there product. 24 dives completed!
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: user friendly and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: It can be easily seen during dives, I was able to clearly read mine at 70ft with about 15-20 ft of visibility
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does a great job
customer_reviews.text: haven't checked against a different computer, but seems accurate to me and is very easy to use and read
customer_reviews.author: jim frye

customer_reviews.title: HUGE!!
customer_reviews.text: Well what can I say, it’s HUGE. If you are female please know how large this is and strap is too long. Will update after next dive.
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Nice dice computer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used this as my back up computer. Worked well for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna Graf

customer_reviews.title: Cressi Leonardo
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for recreational diving! Easy to use, A bit too much info such as planning the dive for recreational diving, But is easy to get used to once you use it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great computer
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money. I've been using them for over 10 dives now and they are perfect
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I absalutly love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Only dove ince with it... will be going again in 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best diving computer in the price range
customer_reviews.text: Best diving computer in the price range. Works really good, and everything in it pleases me. It's bulky, but them again i don't see that as a problem for a diving computer. Used all through my technical course. It has a gauge mode and i asume it'd work well as a backup computer
customer_reviews.author: Matheus O.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. The only issue I had,was that it arrived in a beat up box. It appeared that it may have been a demo, or taken off the show room floor. Functions just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Fhazard

customer_reviews.title: High recommendation
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived earlier thanks for seller , really it is amazing computer to use and the most data required for diving are available , I dived 3 times with it and I enjoyed , I recommend this product that has highly quality
customer_reviews.author: Laith Z.

customer_reviews.title: Na
customer_reviews.text: Way to big for women’s wrist. Should advertise it’s a mans watch
customer_reviews.author: Elsa B Hess

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Put it on and dive. Provides easy interpretation for safer dives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It came scratched and worn out. It looks used
customer_reviews.text: The watch and Cressi are great. I am rating the seller. My dive computer has a yellow tint with several scratches. It was either stored poorly or used and return (I ordered a new one).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best starter computer, Green-my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I like the green, was harder to find than the other colors, Thank you! I wish the alarm was louder or had a choice of a lower tone, I can't hear the alarms, the girls can but my older man ears can't. Good solid computer for starters, and will be my backup if I ever upgrade to the big buck computers.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Dive Computer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my SCUBA diving daughter. She really likes it. Works great for her. Her only complaint is that moderate hand movements set off the rapid ascent alarm. That's actually a good thing though, in my opinion. Better safe than sorry. Otherwise it's an excellent product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Neese

customer_reviews.title: Used? Damaged item?
customer_reviews.text: When I recieved, the screen was scratched. Not good, but since I live in Colombia, returning this is not as easy (cheap) as you would think. This wasn't good because I bought this as a gift for my fiancé. I gave it to him anyway. Today he used it and guess what: now it has water in it. The water came in the computer!! This is unacceptable! This is what it is for, right? So...that's money "down the drain" Update March 8th 2015 I'm updating after more use. I am raising to 3 starts after the water disappeared, apparently is normal. But it still looks used, that's the reason for the calification.
customer_reviews.author: Paola Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great look.
customer_reviews.text: I learned on a Mares Puck Pro and loved switching over to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Great computer, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have the Mares Puck, and ordered this Cressi for my daughter. The Cressi works great, and is more intutive than the Mares for reviewing the dive log and other basic functionallity.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Morris

customer_reviews.title: Very bad display
customer_reviews.text: Horrible contrast on the display in the daylight and in diving. I tried to get support from the dealer to help, but no success.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Singh

customer_reviews.title: Good buy as a first purchase and will serve well as a back up computer
customer_reviews.text: Unable to reset the dives. The back light time is too short. Straps are way to long. Neither temp or start times are saved.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Goudahn

customer_reviews.title: First Dive Computer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first dive computer. I love it. It's easy to use and works great. It's bulky with a long wristband but I still loved it. I tucked the tail end of the wristband back so that it wouldn't impair my view of the screen. I have absolutely no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mayeg

customer_reviews.title: Great but missing a watch band screw.
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, but missing one of the screws for the watch band. Need to have seller contact me to send a replacement screw.
customer_reviews.author: John Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It works great while diving. I wish there were two buttons to help navigate through the screens and a water temp display would be awesome. But for the price it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice watch but just save the $ and get yourself and integrated computer because why not
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fast shipping, good product
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for your fast shipping and I like my diving computer ! I cannot wait diving in Phucket on Feb, 2019! Thanks :)
customer_reviews.author: wonny52

customer_reviews.title: Used
customer_reviews.text: The box looked like it traveled around the world n so did the watch.the watch had been tried on several times the band was worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Brotz

customer_reviews.title: For beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great for normal diving, a little big and the backlight not too bright
customer_reviews.author: Ariel P

customer_reviews.title: great dive computer for novice divers
customer_reviews.text: Simple 1 button functions. Activates when it hits the water.. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Simon W.

customer_reviews.title: Great wrist computer
customer_reviews.text: as a recently certified diver I was looking for a computer that was both affordable and reliable. This Cressi is both...an easy to use, very readable and so far reliable dive computer.
customer_reviews.author: Willy Mac

customer_reviews.title: Good for a first dive computer
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid computer. Wrist band is quite long and there isn't any sort of adjustments available. Easy to read screen and easy to operate despite the single button.
customer_reviews.author: RLanna

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 5 dives
customer_reviews.text: Horrible dive computer. Avoid at all cost and just go with a suunto. After 5 dives the computer has water in it and won’t work.
customer_reviews.author: sarah hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I don't like is that you have to wait 48 hours after ...
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like is that you have to wait 48 hours after free diving with it to use it for scuba again.
customer_reviews.author: Metalhead

customer_reviews.title: Great value Dive Computer.
customer_reviews.text: Great watch did everything I needed underwater. No frills and the one button is a bit annoying to go back/forth, but cannot beat it for price and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: joshua a siler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to see while diving and also very easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to see while diving and also very easy to use the one button. The only thing I did not like is that it is very BIG.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre Fujimoto

customer_reviews.title: ... packaging has al been ripped already and it looks like the watch has had a trip to the beach
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting this to be a second hand product but the packaging has al been ripped already and it looks like the watch has had a trip to the beach. Yet to explore it fully but this is disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Louise Ryder

customer_reviews.title: 非常好用
customer_reviews.text: 价格很不错,非常好用,就是表盘有点大,比较适合初学者。 VERY NICE PIRCE ,GOOD EXPERIENCE, NEW DIVERS WILL LIKE IT.JUST A LITTLE BIG . that's all ,i will use it in SPIDAN
customer_reviews.author: bill6688

product_meta.title: Cressi Leonardo Underwater Diving Computer, Created in Italy, Quality Since 1946
product_meta.description: Leonardo first and only dive computer designed and built completely in the Cressi An elegant expression of simple, functional design, the Leonardo is a must-have for divers entering the sport and those who “just want to dive.” A single button interface makes it effortless to program Air, Nitrox and Gauge modes the first time a diver picks the computer up, and an edge-to-edge, high-definition screen gives large numerical displays in a computer that is still compact and travel-friendly. The clearly visible battery life indicator and distinct audible alarms deliver critical information as well as peace-of-mind during the dive. The Leonardo can also be fully re-set after each use, making it an excellent choice for rental departments.-Air, Nitrox and Gauge modes -FO2 adjustable between 21% and 50% -PO2 adjustable between 1.2 bar and 1.6 bar -CNS oxygen toxicity graphic indicator -Single button interface (short push changes function, longer push selects functions) -Three levels of user-adjustable conservatism -User-selectable Deep Stop function -Modified Haldne and Wienke algorithm -Tissues: 9 with saturation hemi-phases between 2.5 and 480 minutes -Ascent rate alarm (10 m per minute) -Log book for 60 dives/75 hours of information with 20-second sampling rate -Battery life indicator -Distinct, easy-to-hear audible alarms -User changeable battery -Adjustable unit of measure: English or Metric -Backlit display -Built-in calendar and clock. -The instrument may be fully reset, in case of renting. -PC/Mac interface with simulator and dive profile (optional)
feature_bullets: A single button Dive Computer makes it effortless to set Air, Nitrox and Gauge modes. Ideal for beginners in Scuba Diving. It is easy to use and easy to read all the information due to the high-definition screen that gives large numerical displays.

FO2 adjustable between 21% and 50%. PO2 adjustable between 1.2 bar and 1.6 bar. CNS oxygen toxicity graphic indicator.Three levels of user adjustable conservatism. Visual and distinct, easy-to-hear audible alarms.
User-selectable deep stop function. Adjustable unit of measure: imperial or metric. Battery life indicator. User changeable battery. Battery model: CR2430.
The interface (not included) uses IR to connect to the diving computer and a USB cable for PC connection. Software compatible with all versions of Windows and with Mac.
The Leonardo dive computer is made in Italy by Cressi, a brand pioneer in Scuba Diving, Snorkeling, and Freediving equipment since 1946.
